body.p:
Louisville May 24/65.
To
His Excellency
Governor Bramlette
Dear Sir,
I lay before you a case in which Executive clemency is prayed -- and you will see its merit by reading the letter of Mr Chambers to you & the indorsement of it by the Comths atty. Mr Dupuy --
Under the decisions of the Court of appeals no Successful defense could have been made to the Sci-fa --

I understood that very reason has been used in other applications for remission of penalties but this is the first time I have ever applied for a remission of one
by letter or petition -- Mr Gaslin who is the applicant for remission in this case is a Gentleman of integrity. and I most cheerfully indorse his application -- and hope you will grant it --

Most Respectfully
Yr. Obt. Servant
A. W. Gazlay

A. M. GAZLAY,
Late Gorin & Gazlay,
Attorney at Law,
COURT PLACE,
LOUISVILLE, KY.

To.
His. Excellency
Governor Bramlette.
Frankfort
Ky
